intro: Coccoloba moritzii, commonly known as the Moritz's glorybower, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean. It is a member of the Polygonaceae family, which includes plants such as buckwheat and knotweed. The plant is characterized by its palmate leaves with five to seven lobes and bright yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in coastal areas and disturbed sites. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in gardens and landscapes in tropical and subtropical regions.
